features: A Gorgeous Huusk Cleaver Knife--Not only does it have all the qualities you want in a Japanese cooking knife, but also its craftsmanship and style are refreshingly unique. Each Huusk knife is handcrafted using a 138-step design and sharpened manually by blacksmiths. That means a sharper edge and lasting durability, so our Huusk chef's knives will stand the test of time.

Sturdy Design--Huusk meat cleaver is made of premium Japanese steel, and rated at 58±2HRC for extreme edge retention. Crafted differently than a traditional Western-style kitchen knife, the most noticeable feature is the outrageous thickness of the blade! Because of that thickness, the blade can be stronger and less likely to break.

Ergonomic Oak Wood Handle--Huusk forged knife has a solid, sturdy oak handle to securely hold the blade. The handle arc is uniquely designed to tuck into your palm, giving you a firm grasp. Each Huusk Japanese knife is extensively weight tested, allowing you to slice with perfect control. By no means fatigue due to extended use prompted to the palm or wrist.

Versatile Camping Kitchen Knife--This multi-purpose meat cleaver butcher knife can take care of a variety of tasks, such as slicing, cutting, and mincing vegetables and meat. And come with an exquisite gift box, our Huusk knives are also the perfect gift for family and friends at Christmas, weddings, birthdays.

HUUSK GUARANTEE--HUUSK is a well-established company and each sharp Huusk chef knife goes through a rigorous test before every shipment. Our goal is to give our customers a satisfying shopping experience.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Tradition Craft Meets Modern Technology Each Huusk knife is carefully crafted using a 138-step design and sharpened manually by workers with more than 10 years of experience. Compared with kitchen knives made with mechanical ways, our knives have a longer service life.

Razor Sharp Edge The 16° V-shaped blade edge minimizes cutting resistance, helps you cut food effortlessly neatly like chopping through butter. Non-slip Design The thickness of the knife is 4mm and the back of the knife has a non-slip design. Because of this design, the blade can be stronger and less likely to break. Ergonomic Oak Wood Handle The ergonomic curved handle, consist of high quality Oak Wood, provides a comfortable feel. By no means fatigue due to extended use prompted to the palm or wrist.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A skeptically honest review
reviews.reviewText: I will admit, I saw a tremendous amount of negative feedback about this particular blade. From quick dulling, to shoddy workmanship resulting in poor fit and finish, amongst various other things. But, I liked the geometry, of the handle and the size of the blade rather than a larger butcher knife, and as a knife Aficionado with years of making knives as well as sharpening them for about everyone I know, I thought why not give it a chance. If it's not all that, I'm not out much.I was pleasantly surprised.First off the ads are very misleading, this is not hand hammered or forged obviously. It is stamped cut steel, but it is what it is. However, right out of the box, which is actually quite nice, it was actually quite sharp near the front portion of the blade about halfway down. While it did not have the shown and discussed jimping as was in the ad, I was glad that it did not because I personally do not like jimping. It's a fairly hefty piece of steel but not overly weighty, and upon putting it back in the sheath actually cut myself. Not being an amateur, these are just things that happen and that was no one's fault but my own obviously. But at least it was sharp enough to do so.Upon measuring the edge geometry, it appeared to be more of a 30° than the traditional 25° that I like, but I re-honed the rest of the blade to all be 30° so it would be uniform. Having done so, I think this might be advantageous insofar as it retained its edge quite well.First things first, make CERTAIN to give it a proper washing. It is covered in grease, which is a very good thing, and the blackening process of the faux forge needs some cleaning as well. Which of course I did again after sharpening at 30°.During processing of food, I sliced thick breakfast sausage which as we know if the knife is not sharp, will often just mash through instead of properly slicing. It did very well. From there I went to slicing potatoes and dicing them for frying, after which I sliced and diced mushrooms. Throughout the process it never lost its edge.I wear large size gloves, and the handle did not feel too small, and actually was quite comfortable and smooth. The chopping and rocking motion of the blade allowed for a multitude of different types of food processing, and no hot spots.After utilizing the blade in its entirety, it still maintained its edge which I can probably attribute to the 30° angle which in this case is good for something that's also going to chop. At the end of the day, I was quite impressed which I did not expect. Not only would I buy this item again, I would recommend it to friends as it is quickly becoming my favorite kitchen knife, and is very handy in a multitude of different handling positions. While the sheath is slightly thin, it functions well, and carries nicely on the hip. And, should one decide to use this in the woods, which I will try some time when hunting, the spine is quite shard, and actually sharp enough to strike a fero rod without having to re-grind to do so. So overall, I am quite impressed with this blade.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Shockingly nice for the price
reviews.reviewText: Bought this knife because we wanted a 'clever' style blade for cutting meat, but did not want to spend a lot of a 9" dedicated clever. I figured this might serve the clever needs and still be useful for other cutting jobs. I'm thrilled with this blade. The thick metal stock means there's good weight to it and lots of metal to last through years of sharpening. The blade was sharp out of the box but REALLY takes an edge well if you sharpen it properly. The handle and balance are good. The placement of the finger hole isn't really useful. I would actually like a hole at the opposite end from the handle so you could secure the far end of the blade for dicing. The curved blade makes rocking the blade for dicing veggies etc a breeze. Great price, recommended. One drawback is that it does not fit any standard knife blocks. If you use the included leather sleeve or a magnetic wall mount that won't matter.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Stays sharp for a long time
reviews.reviewText: I butcher a beef and several deer a year in the fall and winter months. Got this knife last year and don't even touch my other knives anymore. It's sharp, sturdy, looks and feels great in the hand, smooth cut. Haven't even had to sharpen it yet and have already been through 2 cows and 4 deer. Fantastic knife.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Heavy duty knife
reviews.reviewText: This knife is definitely sharp. I must of cut myself with it five times 🤣. Its super heavy and good quality. Hasnt rusted yet which i was nervous about happening. Worth s buy if you dont mind super heavy knives

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Forged in Darkness
reviews.reviewText: This meat cleaver is an absolute powerhouse, hand-forged to perfection. The razor-sharp blade effortlessly cuts through meat like a Viking through enemy lines.The included sheath adds a touch of elegance while keeping my fingers safe from the blade's formidable edge. The craftsmanship of this knife is a true testament to its Japanese roots, and the hand-forged quality is evident in every slice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sharp as heck!!!
reviews.reviewText: We bought this thing as we needed something for spatchcocking our Turkey. My wife wanted heavy duty shears to be able to cut through the bone but we couldn’t get any in time. Ordered this, showed up same day. I washed it & we put it to use & bam this thing went right through the bones and all!! Great weight, great edge, super sharp & worked way better than expected!! Would highly recommend for all of your kitchen needs!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best I've ever had....
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love this knife, extremely sharp and very well balanced. Feels great in my hands, it's great for meats or vegetables! I promise you won't regret buying these knives!!!!! I now have 3 of them, a friend gave me one in August and it's still as sharp as the first day. I have put all my other knives away.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My Husband bought me this knife for Christmas and I absolutely love it. I have used it multiple times since then and cannot tell that it has lost its sharpness at all. When I say sharp, I mean like bumping it and it giving a good little bleeder. I will say I left it laying on the counter for a day or two out of its sleeve and it looked dull in color like it needed some mineral rubbed on the metal. Aside from that I have no complaints so far. I have cut meat and veggies with it and had no issues. It cuts like a knife through soft butter on everything so far.

I’m very happy that I purchased this knife one thing to note the knife comes very very sharpened so please be careful when handling this knife. It cuts very very well and I enjoy cooking with it. I’ll end up by saying this if I say, buy it, just buy for I’m that person that is very sceptical of things but this is amazing
I like its small but very sharp and strong knife.
